title: How To Initiate a Friends with Benefits (FWB) Relationship

steps.title: Availability
steps.content: Availability When you think about availability here, you're not just thinking in terms of whether the person is in a committed relationship. Not everyone can separate emotions and sex—and not everyone wants to. You want a friend who is down for a casual, sexual relationship and won't expect it to eventually develop into something more. Tovar recommends that you "let your friend know exactly where you are in life right now and how much you wish and desire for a friends with benefits relationship. Watch their reaction closely for signs of approval or disapproval." [1] X Expert Source Supatra Tovar, PsyD, RD Licensed Clinical Psychologist (PSY #31949), Registered Dietitian, & Fitness Expert Expert Interview. 6 October 2021.

steps.title: Proximity
steps.content: Proximity Trying to start a FWB relationship with a really close friend isn't the best idea. You're already emotionally intimate with them and have a strong connection that it can be easy to confuse with romance. Instead, look for someone who you know of but don't necessarily know super well. That'll make it easier to avoid getting emotionally entangled. Think in terms of people you might always see when you're out with a large group of friends but have never hung out with one on one. A friend of a friend can work too. Spread the word that you're looking and who knows, your BFF might introduce you to her cute coworker.

steps.title: Physical attraction
steps.content: Physical attraction You're looking for someone to hook up with, so don't be afraid to let looks take the front seat here. They're already a friend—go for somebody you'll have fun enjoying those benefits with. If you want to have a lot of fun, you might go for someone who you know wouldn't be a good match for you date-wise. For example, if you're a free-spirited artist, you might go for a FWB relationship with a friend who has an MBA and works in finance.

steps.title: Emotional maturity
steps.content: Emotional maturity When you're looking for a friend with benefits, you're looking for someone who can handle themselves and won't catch feelings after the first evening you spend between the sheets. Someone who has a reputation for being clingy, or who has harbored a crush on you (even in the distant past) might not be the best choice for a friend with benefits. It's too likely that their feelings will get in the way. [2] X Trustworthy Source Go Ask Alice Medical advice site with content written by health promotion specialists affiliated with Columbia University Go to source A FWB relationship necessarily involves a lot of gray areas and if one of you isn't equipped to handle those areas, things could potentially turn sour. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Sexual experience
steps.content: Sexual experience Since this is a sexual relationship, the ideal FWB has had at least a few sexual partners and has a sex-positive attitude. If you find someone without a lot of sexual hangups who's down to experiment, you can have a lot of fun and learn a lot about yourself sexually in the process. Someone who has experience with casual sexual relationships is also great because they have a general idea of what to expect. Tovar notes that "you may think you know everything about this friend enough to start a conversation about adding benefits, but it's a safe bet you don't know everything, such as current and past sexual history." [4] X Expert Source Supatra Tovar, PsyD, RD Licensed Clinical Psychologist (PSY #31949), Registered Dietitian, & Fitness Expert Expert Interview. 6 October 2021. "Finding this out before you make a proposal," Tovar adds, "can be really helpful and keep you from making a potential mistake should you hear something you don't like." [5] X Expert Source Supatra Tovar, PsyD, RD Licensed Clinical Psychologist (PSY #31949), Registered Dietitian, & Fitness Expert Expert Interview. 6 October 2021.

steps.title: Flirt with the person you're interested in.
steps.content: Flirt with the person you're interested in. There's nothing like a little casual flirtation to help someone understand that you might be interested in doing something a bit less platonic. Pay attention to how receptive they are when you flirt with them—that'll help you figure out if they might be interested in hooking up. [6] X Trustworthy Source Go Ask Alice Medical advice site with content written by health promotion specialists affiliated with Columbia University Go to source If they don't seem to pick up on your flirting, it might be because they just don't think of you in that way. If you still want to try something with them, you might have to be more direct.

steps.title: Turn a conversation toward the topic of sex.
steps.content: Turn a conversation toward the topic of sex. There's no way you can know how open somebody is to casual sex unless you talk about it. If they're open and willing to talk about sex casually, chances are they're equally down to have casual sex as well. You can also use this conversation to get a general idea of their experience and what they enjoy in bed. [7] X Trustworthy Source Go Ask Alice Medical advice site with content written by health promotion specialists affiliated with Columbia University Go to source Talking about fantasies can be a great way to set the mood as well. If both of you are already thinking about sex, it won't take much to get things moving in that direction.

steps.title: Set the stage for something sexy to happen.
steps.content: Set the stage for something sexy to happen. Since you're the one initiating things, you're the one who's probably going to have to make the first move. If you're not used to initiating sexual encounters, you might feel awkward but try not to overthink it. Once you get the ball rolling, neither of you will be thinking about how it started. Don't worry about planning some big seduction if that's not your style. You could just casually mention that you'd be down if they were interested and see how they respond. For example, you might ask them for a ride back to your place, then convince them to come up for a drink.

steps.title: Keep things casual and don't spend the night.
steps.content: Keep things casual and don't spend the night. While sleeping together might be a euphemism for having sex, actually sleeping together is a bit too intimate if you're planning on making this a regular thing. When you hook up, make sure it's not too late and whoever's visiting has a safe way to get home. The other thing about not spending the night is not dealing with the morning, which can be super awkward if you're not trying to build a romantic connection.

steps.title: Text the person the next day and propose a FWB arrangement.
steps.content: Text the person the next day and propose a FWB arrangement. Keep things positive, fun, and light-hearted. Let them know that you had a great time and that you'd like to do it on a more regular basis. Hopefully, they had just as much fun as you did and are totally interested in going there again. [8] X Research source For example, you might say, "Hey, I had a really great time last night... how wild would it be if we made that a regular thing, like friends with benefits?" If they're not interested in starting a FWB thing, keeping your tone light gives them an easy way to back out without feeling like they're rejecting you. You might stress that you're not interested in dating or starting a romantic relationship. This can be especially helpful if the two of you have talked about this topic before.

steps.title: Set relationship ground rules.
steps.content: Set relationship ground rules. At some point, maybe the next time the two of you are hanging out after you've agreed to start a FWB relationship, take a few minutes to talk about the rules you want to have. While you'll likely have things come up as you go along, if there's anything on your mind from the outset, it's best to get it out there before it becomes a problem. [9] X Research source For example, the two of you might decide that even though you're "just" friends with benefits, you don't actually want to be involved with anyone else sexually. While it might seem weird to be monogamous friends with benefits, it's increasingly common among people who want a regular sexual partner without emotional strings attached.. [10] X Research source Keegan emphasizes that "the rules are between the two of you." He would encourage you to remember that "the key word is 'relationship.' And there are so many ways and so many kinds of relationships that we can have." [11] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 14 December 2022. Keegan notes as an example that even though you decide that you're both free to date, you might agree not to date each other's exes or mutual friends, something like that. [12] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 14 December 2022. Reader Poll: We asked 175 wikiHow readers what factor they consider most important for the success of a polyamorous relationship, and 60% of them said honesty and open communication between partners. [Take Poll] This is also true for friends-with-benefits and any other type of romantic or sexual relationship.

steps.title: Mention any sexual boundaries or limits you might have.
steps.content: Mention any sexual boundaries or limits you might have. Since this is primarily a sexual relationship, be totally open about what you like and don't like sexually and what you want to try. Don't forget fantasies—the no-strings nature of the relationship can present an opportunity to try things that would be awkward with a romantic partner. Due to the FWB nature of the relationship, you might have other boundaries related to emotional connection. For example, you might not want to cuddle after sex or spend the night with each other. [13] X Research source Tovar notes that "getting as specific as possible will help eliminate confusion, mixed signals, and potential problems or fights in the future." [14] X Expert Source Supatra Tovar, PsyD, RD Licensed Clinical Psychologist (PSY #31949), Registered Dietitian, & Fitness Expert Expert Interview. 6 October 2021.

steps.title: Hook up with each other on a casual basis.
steps.content: Hook up with each other on a casual basis. Now it's time to enjoy all of those benefits! Take care not to make your hook-ups too regular—seeing too much of each other can cause you to get too emotionally attached. Instead, aim for sporadic, seemingly random hook-ups interspersed with your normal friend things. You might be casual about your attachment to each other, but don't be casual about your protection against pregnancy and STIs. Get tested regularly and keep an open dialogue with each other about safer sex. Keegan notes that at a minimum, you want to make sure "that you are using protection and being safe and not bringing STDs over to each other." [15] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 14 December 2022.

steps.title: Focus on physical over emotional connection.
steps.content: Focus on physical over emotional connection. In a FWB relationship, you have to learn to keep your feelings to yourself. Talk about the things you like about what your friend does or how they look rather than any emotional support they might offer. While it stands to reason that you'll have at least some emotional connection with a friend, the aim is to keep that from bleeding into romance territory. [16] X Research source While friends do tend to lean on each other for emotional support, too much of that with a friend with benefits can make the whole situation feel more like a romance. This is the main reason it's best to choose someone who you aren't super close to already. Respect each other's boundaries, especially when it comes to emotional attachment.

steps.title: Check in with each other regularly on the state of your relationship.
steps.content: Check in with each other regularly on the state of your relationship. Keeping your emotions in check can be tough in these kinds of arrangements, especially if you were previously pretty close to the person you started hooking up with. Talking things out can give you the reassurance you need that the two of you are on the same page and care about each other's wellbeing. [17] X Research source Keegan emphasizes that "it's really being honest and clear with each other at every step of the way what this relationship is. And if someone else feels differently, they have to reassess should they continue with the relationship." [18] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 14 December 2022. Tovar recommends that you "find out how often you need to check in with each other" and then follow through. "Sex between friends can seem fairly innocuous," she cautions, "but sometimes strong feelings of attachment can develop between one or both partners." [19] X Expert Source Supatra Tovar, PsyD, RD Licensed Clinical Psychologist (PSY #31949), Registered Dietitian, & Fitness Expert Expert Interview. 6 October 2021.

steps.title: Let the relationship go after a couple of months.
steps.content: Let the relationship go after a couple of months. FWB relationships are temporary by their very nature. When things continue for longer, it becomes much more likely that the relationship will end badly and somebody will end up getting hurt. If you're having regular check-ins, you'll probably be able to get a sense for when it's time to let the "benefits" part of your relationship go. "It's important to remember that you were friends first," Tovar notes. "Staying friends no matter what should be a priority." [20] X Expert Source Supatra Tovar, PsyD, RD Licensed Clinical Psychologist (PSY #31949), Registered Dietitian, & Fitness Expert Expert Interview. 6 October 2021. If one of you is dating around or wants to start dating someone exclusively, it's probably a good idea to go ahead and call it quits on being FWBs.

steps.title: What is a friends-with-benefits relationship?
steps.content: What is a friends-with-benefits relationship? A friends-with-benefits relationship involves having sex with someone you have a platonic relationship with. Since most people also consider their romantic partners to be friends, it can be hard to draw the line—but the key difference is the level of commitment you have for each other. [21] X Research source For example, you wouldn't feel as though you had to consult your FWB before you took your family up on a free weekend trip to the mountains. But if they were your romantic partner, you'd likely want to talk to them before you accepted the invitation.

steps.title: How long do FWB relationships usually last?
steps.content: How long do FWB relationships usually last? Most FWB relationships tend to last a month or two and kind of taper off on their own and just kind of fizzle out. The casual nature of the whole affair means that people involved in these dynamics don't tend to have much invested in keeping them going. [22] X Research source The vast majority of FWB relationships either end or change into something else after a year, so don't go into this expecting it to be a long-term thing. Typically, FWB relationships are designed to be transitional in some way. For example, if you're getting over a recent breakup, you might use a FWB relationship to reconnect with your sexuality while you're still healing emotionally.

steps.title: What happens if one of the friends catches feelings for the other?
steps.content: What happens if one of the friends catches feelings for the other? Having sex with someone churns up a lot of feel-good hormones in your brain that feel a lot like falling in love. Despite your best intentions, sometimes one of you catches feelings while the other doesn't. What specifically happens depends on the two of you but it's usually pretty awkward and uncomfortable at best. If you're the one with the feelings, try going "no contact" with your friend for a couple of weeks. That will usually be long enough for those feelings to subside. If your FWB has caught feelings for you, suggest that the two of you take a break for a little while. That will give them time to calm down a little.

steps.title: Can FWB relationships turn into dating relationships?
steps.content: Can FWB relationships turn into dating relationships? They can, although it's perhaps not as common as popular culture would suggest. The FWB-turned-life partner might be a rom-com trope, but most FWB relationships fizzle before they evolve into a deeper connection. [23] X Research source Sometimes, FWBs can do dating-type things together while still insisting that they're just friends. That can lead to "situationship" type confusion due to mixed signals about what kind of relationship this is.

steps.title: What's the difference between FWB and a situationship?
steps.content: What's the difference between FWB and a situationship? A situationship is something that's partly like a romantic relationship and partly like a friendship. Keegan explains that unlike a FWB relationship, in a situationship you have "some intimacy with that person or [feel] a deep connection in some way." [24] X Expert Source John Keegan Dating Coach Expert Interview. 14 December 2022. While this isn't always the case, a FWB relationship can turn into a situationship if one of you catches feelings for the other and doesn't say anything about it. A situationship can also develop if both of you have feelings for each other but aren't ready to be in a full-fledged romantic relationship. For example, you might've both recently had bad breakups. Setting firm boundaries in your FWB relationship can keep it from drifting into a situationship. [25] X Research source

steps.title: How can you tell when an FWB relationship has run its course?
steps.content: How can you tell when an FWB relationship has run its course? One of the best ways to tell if a FWB relationship has run its course is if it starts to feel like work. If you have to make an effort to hook up with your FWB, or if you find the time between hookups expanding, it's probably time to just let it fade. Often, a FWB relationship will just sort of fade out on its own once the two of you get involved with something else that starts taking up more of your time. This tends to happen if the relationship started in a transitional time, such as when one of you is recovering from a breakup. Sometimes your situation provides a convenient endpoint for a FWB relationship. For example, you might have a FWB while you're at school and just cut it off when the two of you leave for the summer. Regular check-ins can help you figure out when things are starting to fizzle out so the two of you can just end things before they get awkward.

steps.title: Can friends with benefits go back to being just friends?
steps.content: Can friends with benefits go back to being just friends? It's totally possible for FWBs to go back to being friends if the relationship runs its course in a natural way without a lot of fireworks. It might take some time before you can hang out together as friends before thinking about sex, but it'll happen. [26] X Research source Even if your FWB relationship ended on a pretty sour note with hard feelings, there's still a chance you can find your way back to being friends after enough time has passed. Studies show that at least a quarter of the time, FWBs go back to being friends within a year. [27] X Research source
